page.title: 01STOW AND DISTRICT
page.content: STOW-ON-THE-WOLD Stow is a small{town,}the highest in the{Cotswolds.}Its position where two ancient roads, the Salt Way and the Roman{Fosse Way,}met has been added to so that now there are seven roads that meet at Stow. This has brought many {travellers}to the area. The Cotswolds were good{sheep}country and over 500 years ago Stow was granted the right to hold two{fairs}a year when thousands of sheep were sold. Now the {limestone}countryside is mainly{arable producing good corn crops. Maugersbury is a hamlet about a mile from Stow and the Swells are two small villages in the valley to the west of Stow. Although Stow no longer has a weekly market it has a useful selection of shops, including 32{antique shops!
